Posts.Content: Oct 24, 2016 09:55AM Samanthavt7091 wrote: My story is much like yours. I just turned 46 on September 1st and was diagnosed on September 13th. IDC 1.3cm, my lumpectomy and sentinel lymph node biopsy is on the 26th of October. I know exactly how you feel. I'm trusting God for total healing. I'm walking out of that hospital CANCER FREE!!! You will too!!!

Discomfort after a MRI guided biopsy (2 lumps) Samanthavt7091 Samanthavt7091

Posts.Content: Oct 14, 2016 12:53PM Samanthavt7091 wrote: I'm so very sorry you found yourself here. I found my 1.3 cm lump via mammogram. My BiRAD number was also 5, which is 95% malignant. Hang in there, I know your brain is going a mile a minute but we'll be ok.
Posts.Title: BIRAD score of 5 KristenSp Moderators

Posts.Content: Oct 20, 2016 06:23AM Samanthavt7091 wrote: Your not alone we are ALL here for you. I was diagnosed on 9/13 of this year and have been through every emotion. My children are 15 and 17 and telling them was so difficult. I still don't use "I have cancer", I rather say I have a cancerous or malignant tumor in my breast. I don't plan on keeping that tumor so I will not show it ownership. Cry cry cry if you need to. And yes, I would wait until after your daughters birthday to say anyting.
